div1.p: Jon Penington and I have discussed your letter and phone call and in no way want to halt any negotiations you might have for other sections of "A Cycle of the West," except for the The Song of Three Friends." In addition we still want the rights to the sections of Eagle Voice that we have incorporated into our outline.

Jon is at my apartment and by this letter we are agreeing to amend the agreement of the 27th of November, 1968 between John G. Neihardt and Jon Penington Productions Limited in so far as we release from the original agreement All sections of the cycle of the West listed under #1 except the Song of Three Friends.

In addition, in order to provide you with opportunity possible to get Three Friendsinto production, we suggest the following. If you receive any queries about the work, please refer them to me. As I told you from the beginning, we cannot guarantee exactly when we will be able to get a distributing company to underwrite production. Should someone offer you a deal that we feel is far better than anything we could possibly arrive at in the future, we will certainly consider relinquishing our rights. Jon has been busy with other films, one of which has just been completed. He will still continue to try to get Three Friends into production. I feel morally obligated to ensure that your father is protected and Jon also feels an obligation. Thus, though his legal rights are clear cut he would certainly be willing to discuss the situation with any other prospective purchasor in order that some arrangemnet beneficial to Dr. Neihardt be obtained.
